channel.title: Need help! commands [pi]
channel.description: i know this is the easiest thing to do but i am having troubles with adding rights to commands.... when i added: [code]("master") && (c.playerRights >= 3)) {[/code] i got an error when i typed t in on the server...... i added this code for yell, pure, and a few other things... the error is: i DC then the server relogs me..... i am using teamtorva v3 [pi]

item.title: Need help! commands [pi]
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:15, topic:425806”][quote author=Daginith link=topic=528468.msg3854444#msg3854444 date=1324248785]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=528468.msg3854440#msg3854440 date=1324248605]

The original PI’s commands are different, and one day loveandpower made it like the one you have, and the hybrid narb released his work .
[/quote]fixed…

funny…

i believe LoveandPower is constantly 24/7 on mopar forums. Everytime i come on he/she is posting on every topic lol.
(sorry for the offtopic post.)

even more funny…
[/quote]what is funny about somebody releasing somebody else’s work without permission ~^[/quote]

sorry. ‘funny’ was a bad word to explain it. =P. you cant really show sarcasm online, lol

Read full topic

item.title: Need help! commands [pi]
item.dc:creator: @Venge_Drop Venge Drop
item.description:
@Venge_Drop wrote:

O Ok. i wasnt really sure on the commands file ive messed with 3 different PI sources and all commands.java files were written the same basically.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help! commands [pi]
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Don’t worry about it, he is banned.

[quote=“Venge Drop, post:7, topic:425806”]usually in PI you dont need the c.playerrights = because you have the lines that split ranks up such as

public void ownerCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) {

and any command under that will be for owners only.
Hope i helped.[/quote]
And btw, not all command.java’s are like that. Mine is completely different.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help! commands [pi]
item.dc:creator: @Venge_Drop Venge Drop
item.description:
@Venge_Drop wrote:

usually in PI you dont need the c.playerrights = because you have the lines that split ranks up such as

public void ownerCommands(Client c, String playerCommand) {

and any command under that will be for owners only.
Hope i helped.

Read full topic
